alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 7:31PM MST until January 02 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches possible, as much as 18 inches above 7500 to 8000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard, Pine-Strawberry and Williams. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel as well as the morning and evening commute for those working Sunday. Snow forecast from 5 AM Sunday to 11 AM Monday: Doney Park 3 to 5 inches Flagstaff 6 to 10 inches Forest Lakes 12 to 18 inches Heber-Overgaard 3 to 5 inches Pine-Strawberry 4 to 8 inches Williams 5 to 9 inches .
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
